name: Vietnamese Crunchy Pickled Jalapenos (Ot Ngam Giam)
description: Say goodbye to bland, mushy pickled jalapenos! These refrigerator pickled jalapenos are crisp and full of flavor. It's the perfect blend of spicy, sweet, and sour. When jalapenos are in season, this is my go-to recipe. This recipe makes about 2 cups.
keywords: pickled jalapeños, pickled jalapeño recipe, how to make pickled jalapenos, Vietnamese pickled jalapenos, Vietnamese pickled jalapenos recipe, Asian pickled jalapenos, Asian pickled jalapeno recipe, refrigerator pickled jalapenos, how to make noodle soup pickled jalapenos, easy pickled jalapeños, Vietnamese crunchy pickled jalapenos, Chinese crunchy pickled jalapenos, ot ngam giam, ot ngam giam recipe, ớt ngâm giấm chua ngọt, ớt ngâm giấm, ot ngam giam chua ngot, pickled, jalapenos, refrigerator pickles, refrigerator pickled jalapeno recipe
recipeInstructions: Make the Brine. Start off with making the brine and allow it to cool to room temperature, or at most, warm. You don’t want it hot because it will cook the jalapenos instead and soften them over time.

Slice Jalapenos. While waiting for the brine to cool, slice up the jalapenos. I like it about 1/8-inch thick. For those who don’t like it spicy, you can shake out the seeds in a colander with wide holes. The seeds mainly hold all the spiciness so fewer seeds means less spicy. Transfer the sliced jalapenos into a container with a lid.
Cover with Brine and Store. Pour the cooled brine over the sliced jalapenos and store it in the fridge. It should be ready to enjoy the next day.
